info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 1:25PM EST until January 14 at 2:15PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Litchfield County in northern Connecticut... Berkshire County in western Massachusetts... Northern Dutchess County in east central New York... Southeastern Columbia County in east central New York... Southeastern Windham County in southern Vermont... * Until 215 PM EST. * At 122 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Florida to near Pleasant Valley, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the Massachusetts Turnpike. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, North Adams, Brattleboro, Great Barrington, Monroe, Adams, Lee, Lenox, Amenia, Copake, Sheffield, Cheshire, Sharon, Pine Plains, Vernon, Becket, Norfolk, Otis, Ancram, and Canaan. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. There is no safe place on a highway when a snow squall hits. Visibility and traction are immediately lost in whiteout conditions, making it difficult or impossible to slow down and avoid stopped vehicles. Delay travel or safely exit the highway before the snow squall arrives. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
